info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 6 at 7:37PM EDT until July 8 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Haw River near Bynum.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pastureland on the right bank and woodlands on the left.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:31 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 12.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued by Monday morning.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON
